unnormalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Your Guide to the Film Festival Scene (Desi Edition)
normalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Your Guide to the Film Festival Scene (Desi Edition)

unnormalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinephiles! Ever dreamt of rubbing shoulders with the next Anurag Kashyap or catching a glimpse of a critically acclaimed masterpiece before it hits the big screens? Then you need to get yourself acquainted with the wonderful world of film festivals!
normalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinephiles! Ever dreamt of rubbing shoulders with the next Anurag Kashyap or catching a glimpse of a critically acclaimed masterpiece before it hits the big screens? Then you need to get yourself acquainted with the wonderful world of film festivals!

unnormalised: Forget those Netflix recommendations for a minute, folks. Film fests are where the real magic happens. They're a melting pot of creativity, showcasing everything from experimental shorts to hard-hitting documentaries and, of course, some incredible indie feature films. Think of it as a mela for movie lovers, but instead of jalebis, you're gorging on cinematic treats!

unnormalised: India's got a vibrant film festival scene. The granddaddy of them all is arguably the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa – think sun, sand, and a whole lot of celluloid! But there are tons of others catering to specific tastes too. We have the Jio MAMI Mumbai Film Festival, known for its star power and cutting-edge programming. Plus, countless regional festivals showcasing the unique stories of our diverse country.

unnormalised: Beyond the glamour and the glitz (yes, there's plenty of that!), film festivals offer a chance to engage with filmmakers, participate in Q&A sessions, and even network with industry professionals. Who knows, you might just be the next Karan Johar in the making!
normalised: Beyond the glamour and the glitz (yes, there's plenty of that!), film festivals offer a chance to engage with filmmakers, participate in Q and A sessions, and even network with industry professionals. Who knows, you might just be the next Karan Johar in the making!

unnormalised: Attending a festival is surprisingly accessible. Many offer student discounts, day passes, and even volunteer opportunities. Keep an eye on festival websites and social media for announcements and ticket sales. A word of warning: things can get crowded, especially around screenings of buzzed-about films, so book your tickets early, yaar! Think of it like trying to get tickets to a SRK movie on opening day – you gotta be quick!

unnormalised: So, ditch the same old Friday night routine and dive into the immersive experience of a film festival. It’s a chance to discover hidden gems, broaden your horizons, and connect with fellow film lovers. Plus, you might just leave feeling inspired to create your own cinematic masterpiece! Just remember to keep some space in your bag for all those festival brochures and maybe a selfie or two with a director. Happy watching!
